recipes.title: She's a Geisha Cocktail
recipes.source_note: Royal Caribbean Izumi restaurant menu card
recipes.description: Izumi's signature cocktail—refreshing and fruity, it pairs nicely with sweet and spicy signature rolls.

instructions.text: Muddle the blueberries and juices with a spoon or pestle.
Pour sake over ice in a cocktail tin and shake it all together.
Pour the contents into a glass (do not strain) and enjoy.

notes: Recipe from Royal Caribbean cruise ship Izumi restaurant
Lime cordial (like Rose's) provides sweetness - fresh lime juice with simple syrup can substitute

recipes.title: Calamondin Liqueur
recipes.attribution: Esther Vonhof of Largo, Marjorie Rosquist of Holiday, Gladys Griessner of St. Petersburg
recipes.description: A homemade citrus liqueur made by infusing calamondins in vodka.

ingredients.prep_note: carefully picked, stems removed, thoroughly washed

instructions.text: Put vodka and sugar in a glass jar with a flat, tight, screw top and stir to dissolve as well as possible.
Add calamondins; seal jar tightly and leave on counter top (upright).
Next day, invert jar. Repeat, alternating positions of jar for 30 days.
Open jar, remove fruit. Enjoy.

notes: The daily inverting helps distribute the sugar and extract flavor evenly.
Makes an excellent holiday gift.

recipes.title: Swiss Mocha Coffee Mix
recipes.description: A homemade instant mocha coffee mix - makes a great gift.

instructions.text: Combine ingredients and put into blender or food processor.
Process until powdered.
To make coffee, put 2 rounded teaspoons into cup of hot water.

notes: Makes a great homemade gift

recipes.title: Blackberry Cordial
recipes.description: A traditional homemade blackberry liqueur made by simmering berries with sugar and adding brandy.

instructions.text: Cover blackberries with water (just enough to cover).
Bring to a boil, then simmer until soft.
Strain through a bag cloth (cheesecloth or jelly bag).
Measure the juice. For each quart of juice, add 2 cups sugar.
Bring to a boil and simmer for 15 minutes. Cool.
To each quart of sweetened juice, add 1 pint of brandy.
Mix well and bottle. Store in a cool, dark place.

notes: 8 quarts of berries makes a lot - start with 4 quarts
Use good quality brandy for best results
Ratio notes: 1/5 brandy, 1½ juice, 1¼ sugar

recipes.title: Jean's Egg Nog
recipes.description: A rich, cooked egg nog with vodka, made from scratch with egg yolks and cream.

instructions.text: Combine milk and heavy cream in a saucepan.
Bring to a boil or simmer.
Beat egg yolks with sugar until light.
Slowly add hot milk mixture to egg yolks, tempering.
Return to heat and cook until thickened slightly.
Remove from heat and add vanilla.
Cool, then stir in vodka.
Chill before serving.

notes: Can substitute rum or bourbon for vodka
Chill thoroughly before serving

recipes.title: Orange Julius
recipes.description: Creamy orange smoothie made with pudding mix and Dream Whip.

instructions.text: Combine orange juice, vanilla pudding mix, and Dream Whip in blender.
Blend for 30 seconds until smooth and frothy.
Serve immediately.
Optional: Substitute strawberries for a strawberry version.

notes: Can substitute frozen strawberries as noted on card
Best served immediately while frothy

recipes.title: Homemade Beer
recipes.description: Simple homemade beer recipe using malt extract.

instructions.text: Dissolve malt extract and put in a crock or fermentation vessel.
Add water, sugar, and yeast.
Stir to combine.
Let set until it quits working (fermentation stops, no more bubbles).
Drain off and bottle.

notes: Historical home brewing recipe
Blue Ribbon malt extract was a common brand
Fermentation time varies based on temperature

flags: Very basic brewing instructions - experienced brewers should use modern sanitization techniques

recipes.title: Dandelion Wine
recipes.source_note: handwritten recipe card (partial - continues on back)
recipes.description: Traditional homemade dandelion wine with citrus and raisins.

instructions.text: Collect fresh dandelion heads, using only the yellow petals (15 quarts).
Place blossoms in cold water and simmer for 3 hours.
Strain the liquid and mix it with the sugar (15 lbs).
Let it boil well.
Strain through cheesecloth.
When lukewarm, add yeast and let stand for 2-3 days, skimming daily.
Simmer the juice of oranges (1 dozen) and lemons (½ dozen) with their rinds in a little water for half an hour.
Add the citrus mixture to the wine. There should be about 5 gallons total.
Put it into a cask and add raisins (2½ lbs).
Leave the cask open for a day or two.
Seal tight and let stand for 6 months.
Bottle the wine.

recipes.pan_size: large crock or fermentation vessel (5+ gallon)
notes: Traditional springtime wine
D.h. = dandelion heads
Requires 6 months aging before bottling

recipes.title: Italian-Style Golden Liqueur
recipes.attribution: Mrs. William A. Crain, Dade City
recipes.description: Homemade anise-vanilla flavored herbal liqueur, similar to Galliano.

instructions.text: Combine sugar and water in a saucepan.
Heat until mixture is clear and sugar is dissolved.
Stir in all 4 extracts.
Cool the mixture.
Blend in vodka.
Add yellow food color if desired.
Bottle and let mixture stand for 3 weeks.
Does not need refrigeration.

notes: Similar to Galliano liqueur
Great for Harvey Wallbanger cocktails
Makes an economical homemade version
Original typed/printed source removed after transcription: Grandmas-recipes - 982.jpeg

recipes.title: Calamondin Liqueur
recipes.description: Florida citrus liqueur made with calamondins, a small sour citrus fruit popular in Florida.

ingredients.prep_note: carefully picked, stems removed, thoroughly washed

instructions.text: Put vodka and sugar in a glass jar with a flat, tight screw top.
Stir to dissolve as well as possible.
Add calamondins.
Seal jar tightly and leave on counter top (upright).
Next day, invert jar.
Repeat alternating positions of jar for 30 days.
Open jar, remove fruit, and enjoy.

notes: Calamondins are a small citrus fruit common in Florida
The daily jar flipping helps extract flavor
Can substitute kumquats if calamondins unavailable
Original typed/printed source removed after transcription: Grandmas-recipes - 983.jpeg

recipes.title: Apricot Brandy
recipes.description: Homemade fruit brandy fermented with dried apricots and raisins.

instructions.text: Combine all ingredients in a large crock or fermentation vessel.
Let stand for 30 days.
Stir once a week during fermentation.
Strain twice through cheesecloth.
Bottle and store.

notes: 30-day fermentation process
Stir weekly to redistribute fruit

recipes.title: Norma Lee's Rum Slush
recipes.description: Frozen rum cocktail with tea, limeade, and lemonade.

instructions.text: Dissolve instant tea in hot water.
Mix all ingredients together in a large container.
Freeze for at least 24 hours.
Scoop into glasses to serve.

notes: Takes at least 24 hours to freeze properly
Slushy texture due to alcohol content

recipes.title: Gin Slush
recipes.description: Frozen gin cocktail served with 7-Up or lemon-lime soda.

instructions.text: Boil water and sugar together until clear and sugar is dissolved.
Add frozen orange juice and lemonade concentrates; stir to combine.
Add gin and mix well.
Pour into container and freeze.
To serve: Scoop ¾ cup slush into a glass and fill with 7-Up or similar soda.

notes: The alcohol keeps it slushy
Can also use Sprite or other lemon-lime sodas

recipes.title: Frozen Daiquiris
recipes.description: Quick blender daiquiris using frozen lemonade. Includes strawberry variation.

instructions.text: Put frozen lemonade, rum, and sugar in blender.
Fill blender with broken ice cubes.
Blend for a few seconds until slushy.
Serve immediately.

notes: Strawberry variation: Add 1 package frozen strawberries, 1 can lemonade, 1 can light rum, and ice cubes. Blend.
Using the empty lemonade can to measure rum gives perfect proportions

recipes.title: Mary Meade's Holiday Eggnog
recipes.description: Classic brandy and rum eggnog with whipped cream and beaten egg whites folded in.

instructions.text: Beat egg yolks until thick and light.
Add sugar gradually, beating constantly.
Still beating, gradually add the brandy and rum.
Chill for an hour, stirring occasionally.
Add milk slowly and fold in whipped cream.
Beat egg whites until stiff and fold in.
Store in covered jars in the refrigerator for a day or so, if possible, before serving.
Serve from punch bowl; ladle the nog into the punch bowl as you serve it (otherwise, you'll get too much fluff on one serving and not enough on the next).
Provide nutmeg for guests to shake over the eggnog themselves.

notes: Variation: Replace 1 cup of the brandy with 1 cup orange liqueur
Best if made a day ahead
Original typed/printed source removed after transcription: Grandmas-recipes - 991.jpeg

recipes.title: Colonial Orange Eggnog
recipes.description: Festive orange-flavored eggnog with ice cream and ginger ale.

instructions.text: Beat sugar, cinnamon, ginger, and cloves into eggs.
Stir in orange juice.
Cut ice cream into small chunks and place in chilled punch bowl.
Pour ginger ale into bowl against the sides.
Add egg and juice mixture slowly, stirring gently.
Sprinkle with nutmeg. Serve immediately.

notes: Non-alcoholic option
Best served immediately while ice cream is still chunky
Original typed/printed source removed after transcription: Grandmas-recipes - 991.jpeg

recipes.title: Sangria
recipes.description: Homemade Spanish-style sangria with orange liqueur and brandy.

instructions.text: Combine liqueur, brandy and sugar.
When sugar has dissolved, add wine and club soda.
If desired, add slices of fruit.
Store in refrigerator in tightly closed bottle.

notes: Donna advises: buy a large bottle of wine for better price per ounce
Add fresh bottle of club soda each time you serve, as it goes flat after opening

recipes.title: Creme de Menthe (Homemade)
recipes.description: Homemade mint liqueur that steeps for 10 days - smooth and refreshing.

instructions.text: Combine vodka, mint essence or extract and mint leaves.
Steep 10 days in a cool, dark place.
Strain through cheesecloth.
Add syrup and glycerine, if used.
Let rest overnight before serving.

notes: Glycerine adds body and smoothness to homemade liqueurs
Add green food coloring if desired

recipes.title: Orange Julius Supreme
recipes.description: Refreshing orange smoothie drink.

instructions.text: Blend ingredients together until like an icee.
Add an orange slice to the glass for garnishment. Serve chilled.

recipes.title: Russian Tea
recipes.description: Spiced tea mix with Tang and lemonade.

instructions.text: Mix all ingredients together and store in covered container.
Use desired amount of tea in hot water to suit taste (1 to 3 teaspoons per cup).

notes: Store in covered container

assumptions: Estimated 4 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Strawberry Tea Punch
recipes.description: Refreshing tea punch with strawberries and lemonade.

instructions.text: In pitcher, pour water over tea bags. Brew 4 minutes. Remove tea bags.
Stir in sugar, lemonade, and strawberries. Serve over ice.

recipes.title: Captain Morgan Spiced Rum Cocktail
recipes.description: Refreshing rum cocktail with cranberry and lime.

instructions.text: In an ice-filled Collins or rocks glass, combine all the ingredients.
Stir to blend.
Garnish with a lime wedge.

notes: Contains alcohol

missing_inputs: Not in database: Captain Morgan Original Spiced Rum
Not in database: fresh lime juice

recipes.title: Bailey's Peppermint Cream
recipes.description: Festive hot cocoa spiked with Irish cream and topped with crushed candy cane.

instructions.text: Mix Bailey's Original Irish Cream Liqueur and hot cocoa.
Top with a dollop of whipped cream.
Sprinkle crushed candy cane on top.
Garnish with mint leaf (optional).

notes: Contains alcohol
Perfect for holiday gatherings

recipes.title: Holiday Sangria
recipes.description: Festive white wine sangria with cranberries and apple.

instructions.text: Combine all ingredients in a large pitcher.
Refrigerate for one hour or until ready to use.
Add citrus slices as a festive garnish.

notes: Contains alcohol

missing_inputs: Not in database: Oak Leaf Chardonnay
assumptions: Estimated 4 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Cranberry Delight Punch
recipes.description: Festive cranberry slush punch with frozen juice concentrates and lemon-lime soda.

ingredients.item: Sierra Mist Lemon Lime or Cranberry Splash Soda

instructions.text: Blend the cranberry sauce, frozen juice concentrates, and spices into a blender on low until fully incorporated.
Transfer the mixture into a large mixing bowl. Add the water and mix until fully incorporated.
Split the mixture between two 1-gallon freezer bags and place into the freezer.
After 2 hours, knead the concentrate inside the bag and replace into the freezer overnight.
To serve, thaw the mixture in the freezer bag until it can be easily scooped.
Place 1/2 cup of slush and 1/2 cup of Sierra Mist into a cup.
Garnish with fresh cranberries and cinnamon sticks.

notes: Non-alcoholic
Make ahead - freeze overnight

assumptions: Assumed 1.5 cup can for frozen apple juice concentrate
Assumed 1.5 cup can for frozen cranberry juice concentrate
Assumed 1.5 cup can for frozen pink lemonade concentrate
Assumed 1.5 cup can for frozen regular lemonade concentrate

recipes.title: Holiday Surprise Punch
recipes.description: Festive punch with ginger ale ice cubes containing maraschino cherries and a hint of peppermint.

instructions.text: Place one cherry in each cube of an ice tray and fill with Canada Dry Ginger Ale. Freeze overnight.
Combine chilled juices in punch bowl.
Add peppermint extract and stir.
Add Canada Dry Ginger Ale ice cubes to each glass.

notes: Non-alcoholic
Ice cubes need to freeze overnight

recipes.title: Dessert Coffee
recipes.description: Hot coffee with flavored liqueurs for after-dinner enjoyment.

instructions.text: Stir together hot coffee and desired flavoring.
Top with a dollop of whipped cream and sprinkle with cinnamon or nutmeg, if desired.

notes: Chocolate-Orange: Add 1 tbsp chocolate syrup + 1 tbsp orange liqueur
Mocha: Add 1 tbsp chocolate syrup + 1 tbsp coffee liqueur
Irish: Add 1 tbsp Irish whiskey + 1 tsp brown sugar
Amaretto: Add 1 tbsp amaretto or hazelnut liqueur
Chocolate-Mint: Add 1 tbsp chocolate-mint liqueur
Chocolate-Cream: Add 2 tbsp chocolate-cream liqueur

assumptions: Assumed 1 unit for desired coffee flavoring
Assumed 1 unit for ground cinnamon or nutmeg

recipes.title: Cappuccino
recipes.description: Brew finely ground espresso in an ordinary coffeepot, or use instant.

instructions.text: Brew finely ground espresso in an ordinary coffeepot. Or prepare instant espresso according to package directions.
In a small mixing bowl beat whipping cream and powdered sugar till soft peaks form (tips curl).
Pour 2 cups hot espresso into six 4-ounce cups.
Add a large spoonful of whipped cream mixture to each cup. Sprinkle with finely shredded orange peel. Gently stir to combine.
Serve with cinnamon-stick stirrers, if desired.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 26)

recipes.title: Eggnog
recipes.description: Always a hit at our annual staff Christmas party.

ingredients.prep_note: divided (1/3 cup for custard, 2 tbsp for cream)

instructions.text: In a large heavy saucepan mix eggs, milk, and 1/3 cup sugar. Cook and stir over medium heat till mixture coats a metal spoon. Remove from heat.
Cool quickly by placing pan in a sink or bowl of ice water and stirring 1 to 2 minutes.
Stir in rum, bourbon, and vanilla. Chill 4 to 24 hours.
At serving time, in a bowl whip cream and 2 tablespoons sugar till soft peaks form.
Transfer chilled egg mixture to a punch bowl. Fold in whipped cream mixture.
Serve at once. Sprinkle each serving with nutmeg.

notes: Chocolate Eggnog: Stir 1/4 to 1/3 cup chocolate-flavored syrup into egg mixture before chilling
Nonalcoholic Eggnog: Omit rum and bourbon. Increase milk to 2 1/4 to 2 1/2 cups

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 26)

recipes.title: Hot Chocolate
recipes.description: A delicious way to warm up.

ingredients.prep_note: coarsely chopped, or 1/3 cup semisweet chocolate pieces

instructions.text: In a medium saucepan combine unsweetened or semisweet chocolate, sugar, and 1/2 cup of the milk.
Cook and stir over medium heat till mixture just comes to boiling.
Stir in remaining milk; heat through. Do not boil.
Remove from heat. If desired, beat milk mixture with a rotary beater till frothy.
Serve hot in cups or mugs. Top each serving with a dollop of whipped cream or a few marshmallows, if desired.

notes: Hot Mocha: Add 1 tbsp instant coffee crystals with remaining milk
Spiced Hot Chocolate: Add 1/2 tsp cinnamon and 1/4 tsp nutmeg with remaining milk
Hot Cocoa: Use 1/3 cup unsweetened cocoa powder instead of chocolate

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 27)

recipes.title: Cocoa Mix
recipes.description: Make your own instant cocoa mix for quick hot chocolate anytime.

instructions.text: In a large mixing bowl combine nonfat dry milk powder, powdered sugar, unsweetened cocoa powder, and nondairy creamer. Stir till thoroughly combined.
Store cocoa mixture in an airtight container.
For 1 serving, place 1/3 cup cocoa mixture in a coffee cup or mug; add 3/4 cup boiling water. Stir to dissolve.
Top with a dollop of whipped cream or a few marshmallows, if desired.

notes: EASY recipe
Malted Cocoa Mix: Add 1 1/2 cups instant malted milk powder. Makes about 48 servings.
Mocha Mix: Add 1/2 cup instant coffee crystals.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 27)

recipes.title: Hot Spiced Cider
recipes.description: Warm spiced apple cider perfect for fall and winter gatherings.

instructions.text: In a large saucepan combine apple cider or juice and brown sugar.
For spice bag, place cinnamon, allspice, and the 1 teaspoon whole cloves in a double thickness of cheesecloth. Bring up corners of cheesecloth and tie with string. Add spice bag to cider mixture.
Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Cover and simmer at least 10 minutes.
Meanwhile, stud orange wedges or slices with cloves, if desired.
Remove and discard spice bag. Serve cider in mugs with studded orange wedges or slices, if desired.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 28)

recipes.title: Hot Buttered Rum
recipes.description: Usually served at Christmas, this hot sipper tastes great all winter long.

instructions.text: In a small mixing bowl combine brown sugar, margarine or butter, lemon peel, cinnamon, and allspice. Beat till well combined.
Use immediately or cover and chill up to 1 month.
For 1 serving, place 1 rounded tablespoon of the butter mixture in a mug. Add 3 tablespoons rum and 1/2 cup boiling water. Stir well.

notes: Butter mixture can be made ahead and chilled up to 1 month
Hot Buttered Coffee or Tea: Substitute 1/2 cup hot strong coffee or tea for the rum and boiling water

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 28)

recipes.title: Glogg
recipes.description: Before sipping this potent Swedish punch, toast everyone's good health. It's tradition.

instructions.text: In a large saucepan stir together wine, raisins, gin, vodka, or aquavit; and sugar.

For the spice bag, cut a double thickness of cheesecloth into a 6- or 8-inch square. Place orange peel, cinnamon, cloves, and cardamom in the center of the cheesecloth. Bring up the corners of the cheesecloth and tie them with a clean string.
Add to saucepan with wine mixture. Heat mixture to simmering.
Simmer, uncovered, for 10 minutes. Do not boil.
Remove and discard the spice bag. Stir in almonds just before serving.

notes: Crockery-cooker directions: Combine ingredients in 3 1/2- or 4-quart cooker. Cook on low-heat setting for 3 hours. Remove spice bag. Stir in almonds before serving.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 28)

recipes.title: Choose-a-Flavor Milk Shakes
recipes.description: Classic blended milkshakes with many flavor variations.

ingredients.prep_note: vanilla, chocolate, strawberry, butter brickle, cinnamon, or coffee

instructions.text: Place ice cream and milk in a blender container.
Cover and blend till smooth. Serve immediately.

notes: EASY recipe
Malts: Add 2 tbsp instant malted milk powder
Peanut Butter: Use vanilla or chocolate ice cream, add 2 tbsp peanut butter
Mocha: Use chocolate ice cream, add 2 tsp instant coffee crystals
Cinnamon-Apple: Use vanilla ice cream, add 1 small cut-up apple and 1/2 tsp cinnamon
Candy: Add 6 peanut butter cups or chocolate-covered toffee bar, blend till coarsely chopped
Cookie: Add 4 chocolate sandwich cookies or chocolate-covered graham crackers, blend till coarsely chopped

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 29)

recipes.title: Choose-a-Flavor Float
recipes.description: Choose your favorite ice cream and beverage combination.

instructions.text: Add half of the ice cream to a chilled 12-ounce glass.
Add enough carbonated beverage to half-fill the glass; stir gently to mix.
Add remaining ice cream. Fill the glass with remaining carbonated beverage.

notes: FAST recipe
Fruit Juice Float: Substitute orange, apple, or pineapple juice for carbonated beverage

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 29)

recipes.title: Orange Breakfast Nog
recipes.description: A refreshing citrus breakfast drink.

instructions.text: In a blender container combine buttermilk, orange juice concentrate, brown sugar, and vanilla. Cover and blend till smooth.
With blender running, add ice cubes, one at a time, through opening in lid. Blend till smooth and frothy.

notes: FAST recipe

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 29)

recipes.title: Fruity Yogurt Sipper
recipes.description: A healthy blended fruit and yogurt drink.

ingredients.unit: ripe large banana, 2 medium peaches, or 1 cup sliced strawberries

instructions.text: If using banana or peaches, cut into chunks.
In a blender container combine fruit, milk, yogurt, and sugar. Cover and blend till smooth.
With blender running, add ice cubes, one at a time, through opening in lid. Blend till smooth.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 29)

recipes.title: Homemade Soda Pop
recipes.description: Make your own fruity carbonated beverage.

ingredients.prep_note: lemonade, orange, apple, grape, or pineapple
4 juice cans for lemonade, 3 cans for other juices

instructions.text: Stir together lemonade and four juice cans filled with carbonated water (three cans if using juice concentrate). Gently stir till combined.
Using a funnel, pour mixture into a 4-cup bottle or jar; seal.
Chill for up to 6 hours.

notes: EASY recipe

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 29)

recipes.title: Party-Punch Base
recipes.description: A versatile spiced fruit punch base that can be served many ways.

instructions.text: In a small saucepan combine water, sugar, cinnamon, and cloves. Bring to boiling; reduce heat.
Cover and simmer for 10 minutes. Chill.
Strain and discard spices. Combine with apple juice, apricot nectar, and lemon juice.
To serve, combine base with ingredients suggested in variations.

notes: Party Wine Punch: Add two 750ml bottles dry white wine. Makes 24 servings.
Spiked Party Punch: Add 1 cup vodka, bourbon, brandy, or rum. Makes 14 servings.
Nonalcoholic Punch: Add two 1-liter bottles club soda or carbonated water. Makes 25 servings.
Individual Cocktails: Per serving - crushed ice, 2-3 tbsp liquor, 1/2 cup base. Makes 12 servings.

recipes.title: Ice-Cream Punch
recipes.description: This creamy, frothy punch is a popular choice for wedding receptions.

instructions.text: Spoon ice cream by tablespoonfuls into a large punch bowl.
Add water and lemonade concentrate; stir just till combined.
Slowly pour carbonated beverage down the side of bowl. Stir gently to mix.

notes: Sherbet Punch: Substitute lime, orange, lemon, or raspberry sherbet for the ice cream

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 30)

recipes.title: Slushy Punch
recipes.description: Keep this slush in the freezer for spur-of-the-moment guests.

instructions.text: Stir together sugar and 2 3/4 cups water till sugar dissolves.
In a blender container combine bananas, half of the pineapple juice, and the orange juice concentrate. Cover; blend till smooth.
Add to sugar mixture. Stir in remaining pineapple juice and lemon juice.
Transfer to a 13x9x2-inch baking pan. Freeze for several hours or till firm.
To serve, let mixture stand at room temperature for 20 to 30 minutes. To form a slush, scrape a large spoon across the surface of the frozen mixture.
Spoon into a punch bowl. Slowly pour carbonated water down the side of the bowl. Stir gently to mix.

notes: Spiked Slushy Punch: Add 1 1/2 cups rum or vodka with lemon juice. Stand at room temp 5-10 minutes before scraping. Makes 26 servings.

recipes.title: Lemonade or Limeade
recipes.description: For fresh juice, use 4 to 5 medium lemons or 7 to 10 medium limes.

instructions.text: In a pitcher combine water, lemon or lime juice, and sugar.
Stir till sugar dissolves.
Serve immediately over ice or chill till serving time.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 31)

recipes.title: Lime Daiquiris
recipes.description: Use the empty can to measure the rum.

instructions.text: In a blender container combine limeade or lemonade concentrate and rum. Cover and blend till smooth.
With blender running, add ice cubes, one at a time, through opening in lid. Blend till slushy.

notes: FAST recipe
Berry and Banana Daiquiris: Use 1/3 cup concentrate. Add 10-oz pkg frozen berries, 1 banana, optional 1/3 cup powdered sugar. Makes 8.
Raspberry or Strawberry Daiquiris: Use 1/3 cup concentrate. Add 10-oz pkg frozen berries, optional 1/3 cup powdered sugar. Makes 7.
Peach Daiquiris: Use 1/3 cup concentrate. Add 3 peaches or 1 1/2 cups frozen peaches, optional 1/2 cup powdered sugar. Makes 8.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 31)

recipes.title: Margaritas
recipes.description: Our favorite blend for this popular drink.

instructions.text: Stir together lime or lemon juice, tequila, sugar, orange liqueur, and 1 cup cold water till sugar dissolves.
Serve over ice.

notes: FAST recipe
Blended Margaritas: Blend ingredients (omit water) with 3 cups ice cubes till slushy. Makes 7 servings.
Frozen Margaritas: Use 2 cups water. Transfer to pan, freeze till firm. Scrape with spoon. Makes 7 servings.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 31)

recipes.title: Bloody Marys
recipes.description: Classic brunch cocktail with tomato juice and vodka.

ingredients.item: celery stalks or dill pickle spears

instructions.text: In a pitcher stir together tomato juice, vodka, lemon juice, Worcestershire sauce, celery salt, and hot pepper sauce.
Serve over ice. Garnish each glass with a celery stalk or pickle spear, if desired.

notes: FAST recipe
Virgin Marys: Omit vodka. Makes 9 servings.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 31)

recipes.title: Sangria
recipes.description: Spanish-style wine punch with fresh citrus.

instructions.text: Cut lemon and orange into 1/4-inch-thick slices. Place the 4 end slices from the lemon and orange in a saucepan; set aside remaining slices.
For syrup, add sugar and water to the saucepan. Bring to boiling, stirring till sugar dissolves.
Remove from heat; cool. Squeeze juice from cooked fruit into the syrup. Discard cooked fruit.
In a pitcher combine remaining fruit slices, syrup, wine, carbonated water, and brandy. Serve over ice.

notes: Microwave option available

recipes.title: Wine Spritzer
recipes.description: Light and refreshing wine with a splash of soda.

ingredients.item: dry white, red, or rosé wine
club soda or lemon-lime carbonated beverage

instructions.text: Combine wine and soda or carbonated beverage. Serve over ice.

notes: EASY recipe

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Chocolate-Cream Liqueur
recipes.description: Pour this luscious liqueur into decorative bottles for holiday gift giving.

instructions.text: In a large heavy saucepan combine light cream, sweetened condensed milk, and instant coffee crystals. Cook and stir over medium heat till coffee crystals dissolve.

Gradually stir about half of the hot milk mixture into the beaten egg yolk; return all to the saucepan. Bring mixture to a boil. Cook and stir over medium heat for 2 minutes. Remove saucepan from heat.
Add Irish whiskey, rum, chocolate syrup, and vanilla to mixture in saucepan. Stir till well combined.
Let mixture cool at room temperature. Transfer mixture to a container with a tight-fitting lid.
Chill at least 4 hours before serving. Shake well before serving. Store in the refrigerator for up to 2 months.

notes: Makes great holiday gifts

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 32)

recipes.title: Grasshoppers
recipes.description: Smooth and refreshing, these drinks are perfect for after dinner or dessert.

instructions.text: In a blender container combine ice cream, crème de cacao, and crème de menthe. Cover and blend till smooth.

notes: FAST recipe
Golden Cadillacs: Substitute Galliano for the crème de menthe
Velvet Hammers: Substitute orange liqueur for crème de menthe
Brandy Alexanders: Substitute brandy for the crème de menthe

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 32)

recipes.title: Tomato Juice Cocktail
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 199 (Freezing & Canning section)
recipes.description: Homemade tomato juice cocktail seasoned with celery, onion, and spices. Can be canned or frozen.

instructions.text: Thoroughly wash tomatoes. Remove stems. Cut tomatoes into pieces. In an 8- or 10-quart kettle or Dutch oven combine tomatoes, celery, and onion.
Bring to boiling, stirring frequently. Cover and simmer about 15 minutes or till soft, stirring often.
Press through a food mill or sieve to extract juice. Discard solids. Return juice to kettle.
Stir in lemon juice, sugar, Worcestershire sauce, horseradish, salt, and hot pepper sauce. Bring to boiling.
Pour hot juice into hot, clean pint jars, leaving 1/2-inch headspace.

notes: Pressure Canning: Process pints for 15 minutes at 10 pounds pressure (adjust for altitude)
Freezing: Cool juice. Pour into wide-top freezer containers, leaving 1/2-inch headspace. Process pints for 15 minutes. Seal, label, and freeze.
Note: Tomatoes should be ripe but still firm. Start with the smaller amount of horseradish and add more until you get the zest you like.

recipes.title: Tomato Juice
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Homemade tomato juice for canning or freezing

ingredients.prep_note: per pint jar or 2 tablespoons per quart jar

instructions.text: Thoroughly wash 8 pounds ripe but firm tomatoes. Remove stems. Core and cut into pieces; drain.
Place tomatoes in an 8- or 10-quart kettle. Cover and simmer about 15 minutes or till soft, stirring often. Press tomatoes through a food mill or sieve. Discard solids.
Return tomato juice to the kettle and bring to boiling, stirring often. Boil gently, uncovered, for 5 minutes.

Boiling-Water Canning: Add 1 tablespoon lemon juice to each hot, clean pint jar or 2 tablespoons lemon juice to each quart jar. If desired, add 1/2 teaspoon salt to each pint or 1/2 teaspoon salt to each quart jar.
Pour hot juice into jars, leaving a 1/2-inch headspace. Process pints for 35 minutes, quarts for 40 minutes.
Freezing: Cool tomato juice. Pour into wide-top freezer containers, leaving a 1/2-inch headspace. Seal, label, and freeze.

notes: Add lemon juice to ensure safe acidity for canning

recipes.title: Tomato Juice Cocktail
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Spiced tomato juice cocktail - start with the smaller amount of horseradish and add more until you get just the zest you like

instructions.text: Thoroughly wash tomatoes. Remove stems. Cut tomatoes into pieces; drain.
In an 8- or 10-quart kettle or Dutch oven combine 10 cups tomato pieces, the celery, and onion.
Cover and simmer about 15 minutes or till soft, stirring frequently. Press through a food mill or sieve. Discard solids.
Return to kettle and bring to boiling. Boil gently, uncovered, for 15 minutes, stirring often.
Stir in lemon juice, sugar, Worcestershire sauce, salt, prepared horseradish, and bottled hot pepper sauce. Simmer for 10 minutes.
Pressure Canning: Pour hot juice into hot, clean pint jars, leaving a 1/2-inch headspace. Process pints for 15 minutes.
Freezing: Cool juice. Pour into wide-top freezer containers, leaving a 1/2-inch headspace. Seal, label, and freeze.

notes: Note: Tomatoes should be ripe but still firm.

recipes.title: Eggnog
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Always a hit at our annual staff Christmas party.

instructions.text: In a large heavy saucepan mix eggs, milk, and ½ cup sugar. Cook and stir over medium heat till mixture coats a metal spoon. Remove from heat.
Cool quickly by placing pan in a sink or bowl of ice water and stirring 1 to 2 minutes. Stir in rum, bourbon, and vanilla. Chill 4 to 24 hours.

At serving time, in a bowl whip cream and 2 tablespoons sugar till soft peaks form. Transfer chilled egg mixture to a punch bowl. Fold in whipped cream mixture. Serve at once. Sprinkle each serving with nutmeg.

notes: Chocolate Eggnog: Prepare as above, except stir ¼ to ⅓ cup chocolate-flavored syrup into egg mixture before chilling.
Nonalcoholic Eggnog: Prepare as above, except omit rum and bourbon. Increase milk to 2¼ to 2½ cups.

recipes.title: Hot Chocolate
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: A delicious way to warm up.

ingredients.item: unsweetened or semisweet chocolate, coarsely chopped, or ⅓ cup semisweet chocolate pieces

instructions.text: In a medium saucepan combine unsweetened or semisweet chocolate, sugar, and ⅓ cup of the milk. Cook and stir over medium heat till mixture just comes to boiling. Stir in remaining milk; heat through. Do not boil.
Remove from heat. If desired, beat milk mixture with a rotary beater till frothy.
Serve hot in cups or mugs. Top each serving with a dollop of whipped cream or a few marshmallows, if desired.

notes: Microwave directions: In an 8-cup measure or 1½-quart casserole combine chocolate, sugar, and ⅓ cup milk. Micro-cook, uncovered, on 100% power (high) for 2½ to 3 minutes or till mixture just comes to boiling, stirring once. Stir in remaining milk. Cook on high for 6 to 8 minutes more or till heated through, stirring once. Serve with whipped cream or marshmallows, if desired.
Hot Mocha: Prepare as above, except stir 1 tablespoon instant coffee crystals into chocolate mixture with remaining milk.
Spiced Hot Chocolate: Prepare as above, except stir ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon and ¼ teaspoon ground nutmeg into chocolate mixture with remaining milk.
Hot Cocoa: Prepare as above, except substitute ⅓ cup unsweetened cocoa powder for the chocolate.

assumptions: Assumed 1 unit for whipped cream or marshmallows

recipes.title: Cocoa Mix
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

instructions.text: In a large mixing bowl combine nonfat dry milk powder, powdered sugar, unsweetened cocoa powder, and nondairy creamer. Stir till thoroughly combined.
Store cocoa mixture in an airtight container. Makes about 15 cups or enough for about 45 (8-ounce) servings.
For 1 serving, place ⅓ cup cocoa mixture in a coffee cup or mug; add ¾ cup boiling water. Stir to dissolve. Top with a dollop of whipped cream or a few marshmallows, if desired.

notes: Malted Cocoa Mix: Prepare as above, except stir 1½ cups instant malted milk powder into dry ingredients. Makes about 16 cups or enough for about 48 (8-ounce) servings.
Mocha Mix: Prepare as above, except stir ½ cup instant coffee crystals into dry ingredients.

assumptions: Assumed 1 unit for whipped cream or marshmallows

recipes.title: Hot Spiced Cider
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

instructions.text: In a large saucepan combine apple cider or juice and brown sugar. For spice bag, place cinnamon, allspice, and the 1 teaspoon whole cloves in a double thickness of cheesecloth. Bring up corners of cheesecloth and tie with string. Add spice bag to cider mixture.

Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Cover and simmer at least 10 minutes. Meanwhile, stud orange wedges or slices with cloves, if desired. Remove and discard spice bag. Serve cider in mugs with studded orange wedges or slices, if desired.

assumptions: Inferred 1.0 for packed brown sugar (standard quantity)

recipes.title: Hot Buttered Rum
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Usually served at Christmas, this hot sipper tastes great all winter long.

instructions.text: In a small mixing bowl combine brown sugar, margarine or butter, lemon peel, cinnamon, and allspice. Beat till well combined. Use immediately or cover and chill up to 1 month.
For 1 serving, place 1 rounded tablespoon of the butter mixture in a mug. Add 3 tablespoons rum and ½ cup boiling water. Stir well.

notes: Hot Buttered Coffee or Tea: Prepare as above, except substitute ½ cup hot strong coffee or tea for the rum and boiling water.

assumptions: Inferred 1.0 for packed brown sugar (standard quantity)
Inferred 2 for margarine or butter (standard quantity)
Assumed 1 unit for finely shredded lemon peel

recipes.title: Glogg
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Before sipping this potent Swedish punch, toast everyone's good health. It's tradition.

instructions.text: In a large saucepan stir together wine, raisins, gin, vodka, or aquavit; and sugar. For the spice bag, cut a double thickness of cheesecloth into a 6- or 8-inch square. Place orange peel, cinnamon, cloves, and cardamom in the center of the cheesecloth. Bring up the corners of the cheesecloth and tie them with a clean string. Add to saucepan with wine mixture.
Heat mixture to simmering. Simmer, uncovered, for 10 minutes. Do not boil. Remove and discard the spice bag. Stir in almonds just before serving.

notes: Crockery-cooker directions: In a 3½- or 4-quart electric crockery cooker combine ingredients as above. Cover and cook on low-heat setting for 3 hours. Remove and discard the spice bag. Stir in almonds just before serving.

assumptions: Assumed 1 unit for gin, vodka, or aquavit
Assumed 1 unit for blanched whole almonds

recipes.title: Choose-a-Flavor Milk Shakes
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

ingredients.item: vanilla, chocolate, strawberry, butter brickle, cinnamon, or coffee ice cream

instructions.text: Place ice cream and milk in a blender container. Cover and blend till smooth. Serve immediately.

notes: Choose-a-Flavor Malts: Prepare as above, except add 2 tablespoons instant malted milk powder to blender container with milk.
Peanut Butter Milk Shakes: Prepare as above, except use vanilla or chocolate ice cream. Add 2 tablespoons peanut butter to blender container with milk.
Mocha Milk Shakes: Prepare as above, except use chocolate ice cream. Add 2 teaspoons instant coffee crystals with the milk.
Cinnamon-Apple Milk Shakes: Prepare as above, except use vanilla ice cream. Add 1 small cut-up apple and ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon to blender container with milk.

Candy Milk Shakes: Prepare as above, except use vanilla or chocolate ice cream. Add 6 bite-size chocolate-covered peanut butter cups or one broken-up 1⅓-ounce bar chocolate-covered English toffee to blended mixture. Cover and blend just till candy is coarsely chopped.

Cookie Milk Shakes: Prepare as above, except use vanilla or chocolate ice cream. Add 4 chocolate sandwich cookies or 4 chocolate-covered graham crackers to blended mixture. Cover and blend just till cookies are coarsely chopped.

recipes.title: Choose-a-Flavor Float
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Choose your favorite ice cream and beverage.

instructions.text: Add half of the ice cream to a chilled 12-ounce glass. Add enough carbonated beverage to half-fill the glass; stir gently to mix. Add remaining ice cream.
Fill the glass with remaining carbonated beverage.

notes: Fruit Juice Float: Prepare as above, except substitute orange, apple, or pineapple juice for the carbonated beverage.

assumptions: Assumed 1 unit for desired ice cream or sherbet

recipes.title: Orange Breakfast Nog
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

instructions.text: In a blender container combine buttermilk, orange juice concentrate, brown sugar, and vanilla. Cover and blend till smooth.
With blender running, add ice cubes, one at a time, through opening in lid. Blend till smooth and frothy.

missing_inputs: Not in database: large ice cubes
assumptions: Assumed 1 unit for frozen orange juice concentrate

recipes.title: Fruity Yogurt Sipper
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

ingredients.item: ripe large banana, 2 medium peaches, or 1 cup sliced strawberries

instructions.text: If using banana or peaches, cut into chunks. In a blender container combine fruit, milk, yogurt, and sugar. Cover and blend till smooth.
With blender running, add ice cubes, one at a time, through opening in lid. Blend till smooth.

missing_inputs: Not in database: large ice cubes

recipes.title: Homemade Soda Pop
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

ingredients.item: frozen lemonade concentrate or frozen orange, apple, grape, or pineapple juice concentrate

instructions.text: Stir together lemonade and four juice cans filled with carbonated water (three cans if using juice concentrate). Gently stir till combined.
Using a funnel, pour mixture into a 4-cup bottle or jar; seal. Chill for up to 6 hours.

recipes.title: Party-Punch Base
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

instructions.text: In a small saucepan combine water, sugar, cinnamon, and cloves. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 10 minutes. Chill. Strain and discard spices.
Combine with apple juice, apricot nectar, and lemon juice. To serve, combine base with ingredients suggested below.

notes: Party Wine Punch: In punch bowl combine base and two 750-milliliter bottles of chilled dry white wine. Makes 24 (about 4-ounce) servings.
Spiked Party Punch: In a punch bowl combine base and 1 cup vodka, bourbon, brandy, or rum. Makes 14 (about 4-ounce) servings.
Nonalcoholic Punch: In a punch bowl combine base and two 1-liter bottles of chilled club soda or carbonated water. Makes 25 (about 4-ounce) servings.
Individual Cocktails: For each serving, place crushed ice in a glass. Add 2 to 3 tablespoons vodka, bourbon, brandy, or rum. Add ½ cup base; stir. Makes 12 (about 5-ounce) servings.

recipes.title: Ice-Cream Punch
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: This creamy, frothy punch is a popular choice for wedding receptions.

instructions.text: Spoon ice cream by tablespoonfuls into a large punch bowl. Add water and lemonade concentrate; stir just till combined.
Slowly pour carbonated beverage down the side of bowl. Stir gently to mix.

notes: Sherbet Punch: Prepare as above, except substitute lime, orange, lemon, or raspberry sherbet for the ice cream.

recipes.title: Slushy Punch
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Keep this slush in the freezer for spur-of-the-moment guests. For each serving, combine equal amounts of slush and carbonated water.

ingredients.item: carbonated water or lemon-lime carbonated beverage

instructions.text: Stir together sugar and 2¾ cups water till sugar dissolves. In a blender container combine bananas, half of the pineapple juice, and the orange juice concentrate. Cover; blend till smooth. Add to sugar mixture. Stir in remaining pineapple juice and lemon juice.
Transfer to a 13x9x2-inch baking pan. Freeze for several hours or till firm.

To serve, let mixture stand at room temperature for 20 to 30 minutes. To form a slush, scrape a large spoon across the surface of the frozen mixture. Spoon into a punch bowl. Slowly pour carbonated water down the side of the bowl. Stir gently to mix.

notes: Spiked Slushy Punch: Prepare as above, except add 1½ cups rum or vodka with the lemon juice. Let frozen mixture stand at room temperature for 5 to 10 minutes before scraping with a spoon. Makes 26 (about 4-ounce) servings.

recipes.title: Lemonade or Limeade
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: For fresh juice, use 4 to 5 medium lemons or 7 to 10 medium limes.

instructions.text: In a pitcher combine water, lemon or lime juice, and sugar. Stir till sugar dissolves.
Serve immediately over ice or chill till serving time.

recipes.title: Lime Daiquiris
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Use the empty can to measure the rum.

instructions.text: In a blender container combine limeade or lemonade concentrate and rum. Cover and blend till smooth.
With blender running, add ice cubes, one at a time, through opening in lid. Blend till slushy.

notes: Berry and Banana Daiquiris: Prepare as above, except use half of a 6-ounce can (⅓ cup) frozen limeade or lemonade concentrate. Then add one 10-ounce package frozen red raspberries or sliced strawberries; 1 ripe medium banana, cut up; and, if desired, ⅓ cup sifted powdered sugar. Makes 8 (about 4-ounce) servings.

Raspberry or Strawberry Daiquiris: Prepare as above, except use half of a 6-ounce can (⅓ cup) frozen limeade or lemonade concentrate. Then add one 10-ounce package frozen red raspberries or sliced strawberries and, if desired, ⅓ cup sifted powdered sugar. Makes 7 (about 4-ounce) servings.

Peach Daiquiris: Prepare as above, except use half of a 6-ounce can (⅓ cup) frozen limeade or lemonade concentrate. Then add 3 ripe medium peaches, peeled, pitted, and cut up (1½ cups), or 1½ cups frozen unsweetened peach slices. If desired, add ½ cup sifted powdered sugar. Makes 8 (about 4-ounce) servings.

missing_inputs: Not in database: frozen limeade or lemonade concentrate

recipes.title: Margaritas
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Our favorite blend for this popular drink.

instructions.text: Stir together lime or lemon juice, tequila, sugar, orange liqueur, and 1 cup cold water till sugar dissolves.
Serve over ice.

notes: Blended Margaritas: Prepare as above, except place lime or lemon juice, tequila, sugar, and orange liqueur in a blender container. Cover; blend till sugar dissolves. With blender running, add 3 cups ice cubes, one at a time, through opening in lid. Blend till slushy. Makes 7 (about 4-ounce) servings.

Frozen Margaritas: Prepare as above, except use 2 cups cold water. Transfer mixture to an 8x4x2-inch or 9x5x3-inch pan. Freeze several hours or till firm. To serve, scrape a large spoon across surface of frozen mixture. Spoon into glasses. Makes 7 (about 4-ounce) servings.

assumptions: Assumed 1 unit for lime or lemon juice

recipes.title: Bloody Marys
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

ingredients.item: celery stalks or dill pickle spears

instructions.text: In a pitcher stir together tomato juice, vodka, lemon juice, Worcestershire sauce, celery salt, and hot pepper sauce.
Serve over ice. Garnish each glass with a celery stalk or pickle spear, if desired.

notes: Virgin Marys: Prepare as above, except omit vodka. Makes 9 (about 4-ounce) servings.

assumptions: Inferred 0.25 for bottled hot pepper sauce (standard quantity)
Inferred 0.5 for celery stalks or dill pickle spears (standard quantity)

recipes.title: Sangria
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

instructions.text: Cut lemon and orange into ¼-inch-thick slices. Place the 4 end slices from the lemon and orange in a saucepan; set aside remaining slices. For syrup, add sugar and water to the saucepan. Bring to boiling, stirring till sugar dissolves.
Remove from heat; cool. Squeeze juice from cooked fruit into the syrup. Discard cooked fruit.
In a pitcher combine remaining fruit slices, syrup, wine, carbonated water, and brandy. Serve over ice.

notes: Microwave directions: Cut fruit as above. In a 2-cup measure micro-cook fruit end slices, sugar, and water, uncovered, on 100% power (high) for 2 to 3 minutes or till boiling, stirring once. Continue as above.

recipes.title: Wine Spritzer
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

ingredients.item: dry white, red, or rosé wine
club soda or lemon-lime carbonated beverage

instructions.text: Combine wine and soda or carbonated beverage. Serve over ice.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Chocolate-Cream Liqueur
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Pour this luscious liqueur into decorative bottles for holiday gift giving.

instructions.text: In a large heavy saucepan combine light cream, sweetened condensed milk, and instant coffee crystals. Cook and stir over medium heat till coffee crystals dissolve.

Gradually stir about half of the hot milk mixture into the beaten egg yolk; return all to the saucepan. Bring mixture to a boil. Cook and stir over medium heat for 2 minutes. Remove saucepan from heat.
Add Irish whiskey, rum, chocolate syrup, and vanilla to mixture in saucepan. Stir till well combined. Let mixture cool at room temperature.
Transfer mixture to a container with a tight-fitting lid. Chill at least 4 hours before serving. Shake well before serving. Store in the refrigerator for up to 2 months.

recipes.title: Grasshoppers
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Smooth and refreshing, these drinks are perfect for after dinner or dessert.

instructions.text: In a blender container combine ice cream, crème de cacao, and crème de menthe. Cover and blend till smooth.

notes: Golden Cadillacs: Prepare as above, except substitute Galliano for the crème de menthe.
Velvet Hammers: Prepare as above, except substitute orange liqueur for crème de menthe.
Brandy Alexanders: Prepare as above, except substitute brandy for the crème de menthe.

missing_inputs: Not in database: white crème de cacao
Not in database: green crème de menthe

recipes.title: Homemade Ice Cream Sodas
recipes.description: Five classic ice cream soda variations including black and white, coffee, lemon, and fruity.

instructions.text: Black and White Ice Cream Soda: In tall glass, pour milk. Top with syrup and a scoop of ice cream. Fill with soda water. Garnish with chocolate curls.
Coffee Ice Cream Soda: In tall glass, pour milk. Add syrup and a scoop of ice cream. Fill with soda water.
Lemon Ice Cream Soda: In tall glass, pour milk and lemonade. Add a scoop of ice cream. Fill with soda water.
Fruity Ice Cream Soda: In tall glass, place fruit puree, milk and a scoop of ice cream. Fill with soda water.

Coffee Syrup: In sauce pan, mix 1 cup granulated sugar, 1 cup light corn syrup and 1 1/2 cups water. Bring to a boil, stirring constantly. Remove from heat. Stir in 1/4 cup instant coffee and 1 teaspoon vanilla extract. Keep refrigerated.

assumptions: vanilla ice cream: used default unit
chilled soda water: used default unit
Coffee Syrup (see below): used default unit
frozen lemonade concentrate: used default unit
raspberries or peaches: used default unit
light corn syrup: used default unit

recipes.title: Coffee-Flavored Eggnog
recipes.description: A warming breakfast beverage with coffee and cinnamon.

instructions.text: Whisk together sugar and egg yolks until light and frothy.
Pour milk in a pan and bring to a boil. Spoon a little of the milk into beaten egg and beat until blended.
Gradually pour egg-milk mixture into hot milk, whisking constantly to prevent egg yolks from curdling.
Divide mixture into 4 heat-proof mugs or goblets. Stir with cinnamon sticks. Adjust sweetness, as desired. Serve hot or warm.

notes: Replace coffee with hot chocolate to turn beverage into a drink for children.

recipes.title: Fruity Smoothie with Ground Flax Seed
recipes.description: A healthy smoothie with blueberries and ground flax seed.

instructions.text: Combine blueberries, banana, yogurt, milk and ice cubes in a blender.
Pulse until smooth, about 2 to 3 minutes or until smooth.
Stir in ground flax seed and transfer to a tall glass. Serve immediately.

notes: Replace banana and blueberries with strawberries, peaches, pineapple, mango, or your choice of fruit in season. Adjust sweetness as needed.

recipes.title: Fruity Yogurt Smoothie
recipes.description: A refreshing mango smoothie topped with cashews.

instructions.text: Combine mango slices, apple juice or cider, yogurt and honey in a blender.
Pulse until smooth, about 2 to 3 minutes.
Divide smoothie into 2 tall glasses and sprinkle with chopped nuts. Serve right away.

notes: Replace mango with cantaloupe slices, substitute apple juice with pineapple juice and increase honey to 3 tablespoons. You may also replace cashew with other nuts you prefer.

recipes.title: Mexican Breakfast Choco Drink
recipes.description: A rich and spiced hot chocolate drink.

instructions.text: Combine milk, cocoa powder, sugar, cinnamon, coffee, vanilla, nutmeg and cloves in deep pan or pot.
Cook over medium heat until solid ingredients are dissolved and mixture is nearly simmering. Do not boil chocolate drink.
Remove from heat and whisk until slightly thick.
Pour into cups and top with whipped cream. Sprinkle grated chocolate and cinnamon over cream. Serve hot.

notes: Serve with breakfast rolls and slices of fresh fruit.

recipes.title: Quick Fruity Breakfast Smoothie
recipes.description: A quick and healthy breakfast smoothie with pineapple and strawberries.

instructions.text: Combine pineapple juice, banana, yogurt, strawberries, wheat germ (if using), vanilla, banana essence and ice in a blender.
Process for 2 to 3 minutes or until smooth. Serve immediately.

notes: If recipe will be made as snack, replace yogurt with vanilla ice cream. Omit ice and wheat germ.

recipes.title: Yale College Punch
recipes.source_note: Cooking Light Magazine March 2009 - From Punch: The Delights (and Dangers) of the Flowing Bowl by David Wondrich (1867 recipe)
recipes.description: Retro cocktails get all the attention these days, but punch predates individual mixed drinks by at least two centuries, according to Punch: The Delights (and Dangers) of the Flowing Bowl ($24; Perigee). The book, by drinks historian David Wondrich, includes historically accurate recipes dating back as far as 1668. Some of the punches call for far-out ingredients like whale cholesterol, but this recipe from 1867 is much more doable for modern-day spirit lovers. It's the 19th-century version of that college favorite 'jungle juice.'

instructions.text: In a large punch bowl, steep 1 cup pineapple chunks in 750 ml cognac for an hour or two in the refrigerator. Add 2 1/2 cups seltzer or club soda and 1/4 cup superfine sugar, stirring until the sugar is dissolved, then add between 375 ml and 750 ml cold demi-sec champagne.

notes: Punch is back in style. Retro cocktails get all the attention these days, but punch predates individual mixed drinks by at least two centuries.
From 'Punch: The Delights (and Dangers) of the Flowing Bowl' by drinks historian David Wondrich.
Includes historically accurate recipes dating back as far as 1668.
This recipe from 1867 is the 19th-century version of that college favorite 'jungle juice.'

recipes.title: Gin Three Ways
recipes.description: Buy one bottle of gin and mix up a trio of cocktails.

instructions.text: French 75: In a cocktail shaker, combine 1 ounce gin, ½ ounce lemon juice and 1 teaspoon confectioners' sugar. Shake with ice for 30 seconds, then strain into a chilled flute; top with champagne.
Gibson: In a mixing glass, combine 3 ounces gin and ½ ounce dry vermouth. Stir with ice for 30 seconds; let sit 1 to 2 minutes. Strain into a chilled martini glass and drop in a few cocktail onions.

Bronx: In a cocktail shaker, combine 1 ounce gin, 2 ounces orange juice and ½ ounce each sweet and dry vermouth. Shake with ice for 30 seconds, then strain into a cocktail glass; garnish with an orange twist.

assumptions: Serving size inferred from beverages category

instructions.text: Dissolve ½ cup honey in ½ cup boiling water. Let cool, then pour into a pitcher; add the juice of 2 lemons, 2 cups apricot nectar and 1 cup vodka, if desired.
Chill. Add a bottle of sparkling apple juice to the pitcher. Serve over ice with lemon slices.

recipes.title: Coffee-Flavored Eggnog
recipes.description: A warm, comforting coffee beverage with the richness of eggnog.

instructions.text: Whisk together sugar and egg yolks until light and frothy.

Pour milk in a pan and bring to a boil. Spoon a little of the milk into beaten egg and beat until blended. Gradually pour egg-milk mixture into hot milk, whisking constantly to prevent egg yolks from curdling.
Divide mixture into 4 heat-proof mugs or goblets. Stir with cinnamon sticks. Adjust sweetness, as desired. Serve hot or warm.

recipes.title: Fruity Smoothie with Ground Flax Seed
recipes.description: A healthy and refreshing smoothie with blueberries, banana, and nutritious flax seeds.

instructions.text: Combine blueberries, banana, yogurt, milk and ice cubes in a blender. Pulse until smooth, about 2 to 3 minutes or until smooth.
Stir in ground flax seed and transfer to a tall glass. Serve immediately.

notes: Replace banana and blueberries with strawberries, peaches, pineapple, mango, or your choice of fruit in season. Adjust sweetness as needed.

recipes.title: Fruity Yogurt Smoothie
recipes.description: A refreshing mango smoothie topped with crunchy cashew nuts.

instructions.text: Combine mango slices, apple juice or cider, yogurt and honey in a blender. Pulse until smooth, about 2 to 3 minutes.
Divide smoothie into 2 tall glasses and sprinkle with chopped nuts. Serve right away.

notes: Replace mango with cantaloupe slices, substitute apple juice with pineapple juice and increase honey to 3 tablespoons. You may also replace cashew with other nuts you prefer.

recipes.title: Mexican Breakfast Choco Drink
recipes.description: A rich, spiced hot chocolate drink with cinnamon, nutmeg and cloves.

instructions.text: Combine milk, cocoa powder, sugar, cinnamon, coffee, vanilla, nutmeg and cloves in deep pan or pot.
Cook over medium heat until solid ingredients are dissolved and mixture is nearly simmering. Do not boil chocolate drink.
Remove from heat and whisk until slightly thick.
Pour into cups and top with whipped cream. Sprinkle grated chocolate and cinnamon over cream. Serve hot.

notes: Serve with breakfast rolls and slices of fresh fruit.

recipes.title: Quick Fruity Breakfast Smoothie
recipes.description: A quick and healthy smoothie with pineapple, banana, and strawberries.

instructions.text: Combine pineapple juice, banana, yogurt, strawberries, wheat germ (if using), vanilla, banana essence and ice in a blender.
Process for 2 to 3 minutes or until smooth. Serve immediately.

notes: If recipe will be made as snack, replace yogurt with vanilla ice cream. Omit ice and wheat germ.

recipes.title: Batch Spicy Coconut Lime Margarita
recipes.description: These tropical batch-style margaritas are a spicy, sweet take on the classic...great for easy serving!

ingredients.item: 2 tablespoons honey or sugar, to your taste

instructions.text: 1. Place the jalapeños (chiles) over a gas flame, or in a dry skillet over high heat. Char the chiles all over, turning a few times until blackened. Remove and let cool, then halve the chiles and de-seed, if desired.2. Combine the basil, tequila, orange liquor, lime juice, and charred jalapeños in a large pitcher. Stir to combine. Chill until ready to serve. The longer the jalapeños sit, the spicier the drink will be. Strain out the chiles and discard. Return the drink to the pitcher and chill until ready to serve.3. To make the lime salt. Combine all ingredients on a shallow plate. Rim your glasses.4. When ready to serve, fill the pitcher with ice. Stir well to incorporate the coconut milk. Pour into glasses and top off each glass with ginger beer (if using). Garnish with basil and lime zest.4. To Make a Mocktail: omit the tequila and orange liquor and use 2 tablespoons of orange juice and an additional tablespoon of lime juice.

recipes.title: Frozen Aperol Peach Margarita Pitcher
recipes.description: With a spicy tajin-lined rim...a refreshing summer cocktail that’s perfectly icy, sweet, and so delicious!

ingredients.item: 1/4-1/2 cup honey, use more or less to your taste

instructions.text: 1. Rim each glass with Tajin. 2. In a blender, combine the tequila, Aperol, orange liquor, lime juice, peaches, and honey. Add the ice and blend until slushy. Add the coconut milk and pulse to swirl it through the drink. Pour into your prepared glasses. Add popsicles and/or mint (if desired). Drink! Drink!

recipes.title: Salted Spicy Watermelon Margarita Popsicles
recipes.description: The only popsicle you need to have stashed away in your freezer at all times.

ingredients.item: 1  jalapeño, halved and seeded, if desired ((optional))
2-6 tablespoons granulated sugar, using more or less to your taste
1/2 cup, plus 2 tablespoons  lime juice, plus 1 tablespoon lime zest

instructions.text: 1. In a blender, blend the watermelon, jalapeño, and sugar. Strain through a fine-mesh sieve into a pitcher. Add the tequila, Cointreau, and 1/2 cup lime juice + lime zest, stirring to combine. Pour the mixture among 6 popsicle molds or Dixie cups. Freeze one hour.2. Rinse the blender out and blend the kiwi, cucumbers, 2 tablespoons lime juice, and 1 tablespoon tequila, blend until smooth. Pour the kiwi over the watermelon layer, filling the molds to the top. Insert popsicles sticks. Freeze until firm, at least 4 hours. 3. Serve with lime wedges and salt...and maybe even a margarita too!

recipes.title: Spicy Serrano Pineapple Margarita
recipes.description: A spicy, sweet take on the classic, the perfect cocktail to sip on with friends & family all summer long!

ingredients.item: 1/3 cup very ripe pineapple chunks ((or 1/4 cup pineapple juice))
2 teaspoons honey or sugar, to your taste
ginger beer, or seltzer, for topping  ((optional))

instructions.text: 1. Place the serrano chiles over a gas flame, or in a dry skillet over high heat. Char the chile all over, turning a few times, until blackened. Remove and let cool, then halve the chile and de-seed, if desired. 2. To make the tajin salt. Combine all 3 ingredients on a shallow plate. Rim your glass. 3. In a cocktail shaker or glass jar, add the pineapple, mint, tequila, orange liquor, lime juice, and honey (or sugar). Add 1-2 quarters of the chile. Muddle together, squashing everything to release the juices. Fill with ice and shake until combined, about 1 minute, the longer you shake, the spicier it will be.4. Strain into your prepared glass. Top with ginger beer, if desired. Garnish with mint and pineapple wedges. Enjoy!

recipes.title: Spicy Cucumber Margarita.
recipes.description: Keeping things fun with this Spicy Cucumber Margarita...uses few ingredients, is a touch sweet, a little bit spicy, and so refreshing...perfect for spring!

ingredients.item: 1/2 ounce orange liquor ((or 2 teaspoons orange zest, see note))
2 teaspoons honey or sugar, using more or less to your taste
1/4 cup pink sea salt or flaky sea salt

instructions.text: 1. To make the chili salt. Combine the salt, chili powder, and sugar on a shallow plate. Rim your glasses in salt, then fill with ice.2. In a cocktail shaker or glass jar, add cucumbers, mint (if using), tequila, orange liquor, lime juice, and honey or sugar. Muddle together, squashing everything to release the juices. Add the jalapeño slices. Fill with ice and shake until combined, about 1 minute, the longer you shake, the spicier it will be. 3. Strain into your prepared glass. Top with ginger beer, if desired. Garnish as desired with cucumbers and thyme, if desired. Enjoy!

recipes.title: Spicy margarita ice lollies
recipes.description: The zingy, fresh flavour of a margarita is always enhanced by a prickle of chilli (see our jalapeño mezcal margarita for example) and these spicy margarita lollies are the perfect way to cool off in the heat. Check out our espresso martini lollies, too.

ingredients.item: 15ml triple sec (orange liqueur) such as Cointreau
Juice 2 limes, plus 1 lime cut into 10 thin slices

instructions.text: In a small pan, mix the sugar, tequila, triple sec and bitters with 375ml water. Add the chilli and stir over a medium heat for a few minutes to dissolve the sugar. Remove from the heat, add the lime juice and leave to cool. (Or put the pan in a bowl of iced water and stir regularly until cool.)

Discard the chilli, then divide the mixture among the lolly moulds. Push a slice of lime into each, add the sticks (see Before you start), cover and freeze for at least 6 hours, ideally overnight, until solid.

Remove from the freezer 10 minutes before eating. Dunk the moulds into a bowl of warm water if needed to help release the lollies. If using, spread some Tajín on a plate, then press the lollies into it to add a zingy crust.

recipes.title: Coffee
recipes.source_note: My hundred favorite recipes (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage recipe using Carnation Milk

instructions.text: Mix the egg and ½ cup cold water and add to the coffee in the pot. Add boiling water, boil up once, stir with a spoon and boil up again. Add the ¼ cup cold water to settle coffee. Serve immediately. Cream with undiluted Carnation. Serves 5.

recipes.title: Steamed Colonial Custard
recipes.source_note: Grandma's Recipes for Mother and Daughter (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage recipe

instructions.text: Beat eggs slightly; add molasses, salt, and vanilla. Stir in hot milk. Pour mixture into 6 custard cups; cover each with metal foil. Place cups on rack or jar lids in pan of hot water, coming half-way to top of cups. Cover pan tightly. Steam over low heat until knife inserted in center comes out clean (about 15 minutes). If water around cups is allowed to boil, custards will curdle. If desired, place a marshmallow in each cup before filling with mixture.
Baked Colonial Custard: Bake custards in shallow pan of hot water in slow oven (300° F.) until knife inserted in center comes out clean (40 to 50 minutes).

recipes.title: Punch-Tea Base
recipes.source_note: International Harvester Refrigerator Recipes (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage recipe

instructions.text: Pour boiling water over tea. Cover and allow to stand 3 minutes. Strain over sugar. Stir until sugar is dissolved. Cool. Add orange and lemon juices and cold water. Ice well. Add ginger ale just before serving punch. Base can be stored in refrigerator for later use. Yield: 10 to 12 servings.

recipes.title: Cranberry Orange Punch
recipes.source_note: International Harvester Refrigerator Recipes (Project Gutenberg, public domain)

instructions.text: Add water to sugar; place over heat and bring to a boil, dissolving sugar. Cool. Add frozen orange juice, cranberry juice, lemon juice and few drops food coloring. Mix well and chill. Just before serving add ginger ale. Yield: 1½ quarts.

recipes.title: Frosty Ginger Ale Punch
recipes.source_note: International Harvester Refrigerator Recipes (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage recipe

instructions.text: Add ginger ale to sherbet in a punch bowl. When sherbet has partially melted, serve in punch cups. Other flavor sherbets can be used. Serves 24.

recipes.title: Spruce Beer
recipes.description: A traditional colonial spruce beer made with hops, molasses, and spruce essence.

instructions.text: Take four ounces of hops, let them boil half an hour in one gallon of water.
Strain the hop water then add sixteen gallons of warm water, two gallons of molasses, eight ounces of essence of spruce dissolved in one quart of water.
Put it in a clean cask, then shake it well together, add half a pint of emptins (yeast).
Let it stand and work one week.
If very warm weather less time will do, when it is drawn off to bottle, add one spoonful of molasses to every bottle.

notes: Original 1796 recipe
Emptins = semiliquid prepared yeast
Spruce beer was a popular colonial beverage
